message.content:
cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.MA. 

The paper deals with epidemic spreading processes in networks, which is a topic that falls under the scope of several arXiv CS sub-categories. The use of external agents to speed up the spread of infection suggests a focus on network interventions and control, which is a common theme in the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-category. The paper also involves the study of spreading times and the derivation of upper and lower bounds, which are typical topics in the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-categories. The use of simple (random/greedy) policies for external spreading suggests a focus on optimization and decision-making, which are relevant to the cs.MA (Multiagent Systems) sub-category. Finally, the study of epidemic spreading in general networks suggests a broader scope that could fall under the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category.
